thread.title: Jay McCarthy's Specialized S-Works Tarmac - Gallery
thread.title_full: Jay McCarthy's Specialized S-Works Tarmac - Gallery

title: Jay McCarthy's Specialized S-Works Tarmac - Gallery
text:
Jay McCarthy's Specialized S-Works Tarmac - Gallery A look at the Bora-Hansgrohe team bike 1 / 25 Jay McCarthy's Specialized S-Works Tarmac (Colin Levitch / Immediate Media) You can see the coloured fleck in the black paint (Colin Levitch / Immediate Media) A closer look at the seat stays (Colin Levitch / Immediate Media) Dual-sided power readings for the Bora-Hansgrohe man (Colin Levitch / Immediate Media) A look at the team colours detailing on the frame (Colin Levitch / Immediate Media) McCarthy rides a 52 frameset (Colin Levitch / Immediate Media) The Di2 junction box is held underneath the stem (Colin Levitch / Immediate Media) Shrink wrapped cables keep the cockpit tidy (Colin Levitch / Immediate Media) Supacaz handlebar tape for the Australian (Colin Levitch / Immediate Media) McCarthy opts for a Garmin out-front mount (Colin Levitch / Immediate Media) A closer look at the Shimano Dura-Ace front brake (Colin Levitch / Immediate Media) The Dura-Ace crankset is equipped with a 4iiii powermeter (Colin Levitch / Immediate Media) Shimano Dura-Ace 9070 rear derailleur (Colin Levitch / Immediate Media) The S-Works Romin Evo saddle is set forward to it's max limit (Colin Levitch / Immediate Media) McCarthy rolls on Roval CLX50 wheels (Colin Levitch / Immediate Media) A fairly short stem compared to the general trend in the peloton of long stems (Colin Levitch / Immediate Media) Bora-Hansgrohe are the only team to ride on S-Works Turbo tubular tyres (Colin Levitch / Immediate Media) CeramicSpeed provide the headset and bottom bracket (Colin Levitch / Immediate Media) Shimano Dura-Ace 9000 series pedals (Colin Levitch / Immediate Media) Skip Ad Jay McCarthy followed his Tinkoff teammate Peter Sagan to Bora-Hansgrohe following the teams' demise at the end of the 2016 season. Peter Sagan alone brought enough WorldTour points to the Pro-Continental outfit to confirm WorldTour status for the German team in 2017, but the World Champion commands a high price and it is rumoured Specialized contributed to the costs of bringing the Slovakian to the team. Related Articles Tour Down Under: Sagan-inspired McCarthy steals final day podium Whilst Peter Sagan has a range of custom painted Specialized framesets to choose from, Jay McCarthy rides on the team issue S-Works Tarmac. Although the team frames aren't as eye catching as Peter Sagan's unique designs, the predominantly black frames could be considered one of the classier designs in the WorldTour peloton. Turquoise pinstripe detailing on the frames tubing and forks is complimented with metallic fleck in the black paint and contrasts with the bold white decals. The Australian rides a compact 52cm frame and is paired with a 106mm stem and 400mm handlebars, both supplied by PRO components, as it the seat post. The standard 172.5mm crankset, 53-39T chainrings and 11-28T Dura-Ace cassette makes up the Shimano Dura-Ace 9070 groupset and is paired with a 4iiii powermeter. The Bora-Hansgrohe mechanics expect the Dura-Ace 9100 series groupsets to arrive in time for the spring Classics. 
CeramicSpeed provide both the headset and bottom bracket and is a brand becoming more and more prominent in the WorldTour peloton. 
Specialized provide the S-Works Romin Evo saddle and the Roval CLX 50mm carbon wheels are paired with S-Works Turbo tubular tyres. 
Swipe or click through the gallery above to see more of the Australian's bike. Full Specifications 
Frame: Specialized S-Works Tarmac, size 52 Fork: Specialized S-Works FACT carbon Headset: CeramicSpeed Stem: PRO PLT alloy, 106mm Handlebar: PRO PLT alloy, 400m Tape: Supacaz Front brake: Shimano Dura-Ace 9000 Rear brake: Shimano Dura-Ace 9000 Brake/Shift levers: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2 Front derailleur: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2 Rear derailleur: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2 Cassette: Shimano Dura-Ace, 11-28T Chain: Shimano Dura-Ace, 11 speed Crankset: Shimano Dura-Ace, 53-39T with 4iiii powermeter Bottom bracket: CeramicSpeed
